lead_paragraph: Christopher Cooley, 78, was found dead in his apartment with a necktie around his neck and a pillow over his head. On Friday, the city’s chief medical examiner declared the death a homicide.

byline.contributor: Al Baker contributed reporting and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and EMILY PALMER

headline.print_headline: A Mysterious Death on the Upper East Side Unsettles Residents
headline.main: A Mysterious Killing on the Upper East Side Unsettles Residents

snippet: Christopher Cooley, 78, was found dead in his apartment with a necktie around his neck and a pillow over his head. On Friday, the city’s chief medical examiner declared the death a homicide.
abstract: New York City police remain stymied by death of elderly Upper East Side resident Christopher Cooley, found strangled in his apartment; medical examiner has ruled death homicide.
